message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.RO, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the fusion of diverse information sources for indoor positioning, which is a common topic in the fields of information theory (cs.IT) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The paper also presents a unified framework for quantifying position-related information, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY). The use of geometric-stochastic channel models and analytical results for the Cramer-Rao lower bound suggest a focus on robotics (cs.RO) and machine learning (cs.LG).
